conversations.description: User uploads a PDF log of Monday’s court research, asks LexTimeKeeper to extract activities and create time entries automatically.
Attorney provides a DOCX file with mixed client matters and wants the system to separate entries by matter ID before billing.
Partner reviews a week‑long activity log and requests a summary report showing total billable hours per client.
Junior associate questions why a drafting task was assigned billing code “CONSULT” and asks the LLM to justify the code selection.
User uploads a plain‑text log containing time‑stamps, asks LexTimeKeeper to convert minutes into standard hour:minute format in entries.
Law firm needs to apply a 15% discount for a specific client’s contract and asks the assistant to adjust billing codes accordingly.
Paralegal uploads a combined log for two attorneys and wants the system to split entries by attorney ID and create separate sheets.
Client audit requires a report of all entries for Acme Corp between 1‑Mar and 31‑Mar, formatted in markdown.
Senior counsel notices a missing matter identifier in a log and asks LexTimeKeeper to infer the correct matter from context.
User wants to override an automatically chosen billing code because the client agreement caps that code’s usage.
Attorney uploads a scanned PDF, prompts the LLM to run OCR‑style parsing, then extract activities for time entry creation.
Firm wants to batch‑process multiple activity logs from a shared folder and generate a consolidated billable hour report.
User asks for a quick check: “Did any entry exceed the client’s daily hour limit?” and expects a flagged list.
Associate files a log with ambiguous descriptions and requests clarification suggestions before finalizing time entries.
Partner wants to see a breakdown of billable vs. non‑billable hours for a specific matter over the past quarter.
User asks LexTimeKeeper to retrieve the billing‑rate agreement for “beta_tech” and confirm eligible codes before entry creation.
Attorney wants to delete a mistakenly created time entry and asks the system to remove it and recalculate totals.
Paralegal asks the LLM to add a custom note to each entry created from a particular log for internal tracking.
User provides a log with activities spanning multiple time zones and requests correct date normalization for entries.
Senior partner wants a visual summary (markdown table) of all entries for a high‑profile case, grouped by attorney.
Associate notices an activity flagged as “prohibited code” by the client agreement and asks for an alternative code.
Firm needs to export all time entries for a specific client in CSV format and requests the LLM to generate the file.
User asks LexTimeKeeper to cross‑check that total billed hours for a client do not exceed the contractual cap.
Partner wants to generate a month‑end report that includes total fees, discounts applied, and outstanding balances.
Attorney uploads a log with handwritten notes, queries whether the system can accurately extract the duration information.
User requests a summary of hours spent on “document review” activities across all matters for billing analysis.
Paralegal asks to re‑run the billing code lookup after a recent update to the client’s agreement matrix.
Associate wants the LLM to suggest more precise activity descriptions to improve future code matching.
Partner asks for a quick verification that all entries for a client fall within the approved billing rates.
User wants LexTimeKeeper to flag any entries where the duration is unusually short (under 5 minutes) for review.
Attorney provides a log containing both phone calls and email drafts, and asks for distinct billing codes for each.
Firm needs a report showing total hours billed per matter for the last fiscal year, grouped by client.
User asks the assistant to merge duplicate entries that were mistakenly logged twice on the same day.
Partner wants to see a breakdown of billable hours by activity type (e.g., research, drafting, courtroom) for a case.
Associate asks LexTimeKeeper to apply a special rate for “pro bono” work and ensure it doesn’t appear on client invoices.
User requests the system to generate a markdown summary of all time entries for a given matter, including total fees.
Attorney uploads a multi‑page PDF with embedded tables and asks the LLM to extract each row as a separate activity.
Paralegal wants to confirm that no entry uses a billing code that the client has explicitly prohibited.
Partner asks for a comparative report of billed hours between two similar clients over the same period.
User asks LexTimeKeeper to annotate each time entry with the client’s current discount tier for internal review.
Associate provides a log with vague descriptions and asks the system to suggest clearer wording for future logs.
Firm needs to generate a quarterly compliance report confirming adherence to each client’s billing caps.
User asks the LLM to retrieve the latest billing‑code matrix for a client before creating new entries.
Attorney wants a quick preview of how many entries will be created from a given activity log before committing.
Paralegal asks to automatically assign the correct matter ID based on keyword matching in the activity description.
Partner requests a summary that highlights any entries where the duration exceeds the typical range for that activity.
User wants to export a markdown‑formatted report of all time entries for a specific date range and client.
Associate asks LexTimeKeeper to apply a newly negotiated discount code to all future entries for a particular client.
Firm asks the assistant to validate that all newly created entries comply with the firm’s internal billing policies.
Attorney uploads a log with mixed language entries (English and Spanish) and asks for correct billing code extraction.
Partner wants to see a list of all billing codes used in the past month, sorted by frequency, for rate‑setting analysis.
User asks LexTimeKeeper to flag any entry where the client’s agreement specifies a “no‑overhead” clause but an overhead code was used.
Paralegal requests a concise markdown summary of total hours per attorney for the previous week.
Associate asks to batch‑update the billing code for a set of entries after a coding matrix revision.
Partner wants a drill‑down report showing hours per matter, per client, and per billing code for budgeting purposes.
